conclusion: Analyze the flow of liquid from containers A, B, and C through the baffles to predict which containers D, E, or F the liquid will flow into.

The image shows three containers at the top (A, B, C) where liquid will flow from, several colored baffle strips placed at various angles on the board, and three U-shaped containers at the bottom (D, E, F) where liquid will be collected.
Liquid from A will fall straight down initially.
The green horizontal baffle will deflect the liquid from A to the right.
The brown diagonal baffle further deflects the liquid from A to the right.
Liquid from A appears to be directed toward container F (the rightmost black container).
Liquid from B will fall straight down initially.
The purple diagonal baffle will deflect the liquid from B to the right.
Liquid from B appears to be directed toward container F (the rightmost black container).
Liquid from C will fall straight down initially.
The light blue/mint diagonal baffle on the left side will deflect the liquid from C to the left.
Liquid from C will likely flow into container D (the leftmost blue container).

Liquid from A (orange) will flow into container F (rightmost black), liquid from B (blue) will flow into container F (rightmost black), and liquid from C (light blue/mint) will flow into container D (leftmost blue).
